data.title: Great quick healthy lunch
data.text: First time at this chain and became a fan.  Enjoyed a salad and a wrap here for a quick lunch on the go.  Everything looked very fresh, nice variety and presented in a clean and helpful atmosphere.  Will definitely return.

data.title: Great Place for Lunch
data.text: This salad place was recommended to us by the gal who sells tickets to the National Aquarium.  She didn't steer us wrong, it was the perfect place to take a vegetarian for lunch.  It is set up like a Subway sandwich shop but much cooler.  You get to pick your protein (I picked the old bay seasoned shrimp) and then just have them mix whatever salad ingredients you like.  Everything was fresh and delicious.  It is pretty pricy for a salad place but not for the inner harbour area.

data.title: Fresh food with good flavors
data.text: Very healthy and tasty food - a good alternative to all the fast food at the waterfront.  It's basically a burrito (wrap) bar with the option of a rice bowl or salad, instead.  They put them together for you.

data.title: Choices galore, and great for picky kids!
data.text:
I wish I could animate 5 stars so fireworks would shoot out. Because I just had a religious experience here. I loved it all. Everything. Even the flooring (tile that looks like reclaimed wood?!)

There are so many choices that it's understandable if you get overwhelmed. Here are the basics: you can order a rice bowl, a noodle bowl, a salad, or soup and pick from a bazillion toppings, dressings, and broths to create a lunch that will help you achieve nirvana. If you need someone to tell you exactly what to get, skip to the end of this review and I'll list what I got and loooooved.

This is place is in a great location, close to the harbor, aquarium, etc. but that also means parking will be a pain *dun dun dun!* That doesn't ruin it for me. Nope. Because when I walked in, I loved the urban chic feel and was wowed by the gorgeous array of fixin's just waiting for me to order them. There are standard menu items (AKA you can order an Asian chicken salad) or you can create your own masterpiece. I am in favor of playing God with my food, though, and created something just right for me.

That brings me to an important point: KIDS! This was great for my preschool aged kids, who were really psyched to choose their own adventure with dinner. For $5 they got a generous helping of noodles with their choice of any of those bazillion toppings, plus chips, plus a juice box. They put together some funky combinations (egg noodles, grilled chicken, shredded carrots, corn, grapes, apples, and chicken broth?), but they ate them enthusiastically.

Bottom line, it's a fantastic deal to eat here. I got my money's worth and felt GREAT after eating my food. All the stars. All of them.

(My specific order if you want to try it: Brown rice bowl with grilled chicken. My greens were half spring mix and half arugula. Toppings: black beans, a sprinkle of jalapeño, corn, cilantro, quinoa, wheat berries, pumpkin seeds, and parmesan shavings topped with a cilantro vinaigrette + chicken broth and tomato broth.)

data.title: Fresh Bowls and Salads, Eager Staff
data.text: My one complaint is that i should have kept a closer eye on how my Asian Bowl was being prepared.  It had too many dressings.  But that's my fault.  The eager, very friendly staff here certainly gives you an opportunity to shape your freshly-made dish any way you want.  Prices are good as well for what you get.  Hope this place does well in this area a few blocks from the Inner Harbor.

data.title: Fresh healthy ingredients make for an excellent alternative lunch spot
data.text: A salad bar extraordinaire is how this restaurant can be described.  A small space with limited indoor seating and a lunchtime queue extending onto the sidewalk, the exceeded our expectations for a well prepared and satisfying meal. The selection of on-demand salad cuisines, along with a wide variety of protein, along with the possibility to concoct your own mix of vegetables, fruits, and other items, makes this place stand out when compared with restaurants where the salad often is an afterthought. All product we had on the day we visited was crisp, fresh, and refreshing. The portions were satisfying and the price reasonable. Nalley Fresh is a healthy alternative for a quick lunch that is not the same old fare.

data.title: Great find for a healthy meal
data.text:
We'd just got to Baltimore's Inner Harbor.  Walking down the street, there were lots of sit down restaurants in view, but we only wanted a quick snack.  
There was a Chick-fil-A with a huge line outside, and right next to it, a small, unassuming doorway to Nalley Fresh. This is a local chain, but I wish there was one back home.  It is like a Chipotle, but better.  
You start by choosing between a salad, wrap or noodle bowl.  Pricing varies by what protein you add to it, then you have the staff mix in whatever yummy fresh vegetables, cheese, and other items you would like; the choices of items to add were really good and varied.
As mentioned - we were looking for a quick snack, so ended up with some soup - they have two daily choices.  Looking at other diner's meals, I wish I had been hungry enough for a full meal, because it all looked great.

data.title: Last breakfast
data.text: This was our last visit for breakfast in the USA. We are going home today. It was very different for us and enjoyable. Muffin, yoghurt, fresh fruit. Staff were efficient and helpful. Seating outside. Good of a high quality. Enjoyed very much.

data.title: Pre Dinner Snack
data.text: We ate at the 400 E. Pratt Street Baltimore Maryland location on August 15 as a late afternoon meal to hold us over until a 7:30 p.m. upscale seafood restaurant. Salads were delicious (two can share) and the unsweetened iced tea was tasty. The staff was very pleasant and consciousness in keeping the place clean.

data.title: Eat here!
data.text: Nalley fresh has some of the best salad I have ever eaten in my life. They have numerous toppings to choose from and you can choose from a number of rotating protein bases.  The downtown location is only open for business lunch and doesn't have much of a seating area, but the other locations are open for dinner and have better seating.  Do your self a favor if you live healthy food an have lunch here tomorrow!

data.title: Lunch - busy but good
data.text:
Wen we went to Nalley Fresh the line was almost out the door, but the lines moves quickly as long as you don't get stuck behind someone who can't make up their mind. 

You can pick from the menu, but why would you when there are so many choices! First pick - salad, wrap, bowl or soup. Then start picking what you want in your meal. I usually get a salad and pick from a variety of proteins, veggies, and toppings. Love the sweet potatoes and beets for unusual toppings. It all gets mixed up and put in a to go plastic box with bread (if desired) and off you go. 

Seating is limited both inside and out, but worth the walk to and from work for a semi-healthy meal

data.title: Great Downtown Option While on Jury Duty
data.text: This is my go to place for lunch when I'm called for jury duty. I just wish they had more seating. There's lots of variety with a big list of "proteins" offered each day. You can build your own salad or pick from a list of salad selections.

data.title: Cannot say enough great things about Nalley Fresh!
data.text:
It was soo nice to have a healthy lunch option near the Harbor.  My husband and I love Nalley's so much we ate there two days in a row!  
Nalley's offers wraps and salads.  You begin by selecting your protein (various flavors of chicken, tuna, salmon, tofu), brown rice, beans, a very nice variety of vegetables and dressings.

I built my own wrap the first day and on the second day I tried the California salad (spring mix, spicy Thai chicken, olives, almonds, asiago cheese, cilantro vinegrette).  It was fantastic.  I'm praying that a Nalley Fresh opens in Western Pennsylvania soon!

data.title: Salad of champs
data.text: I was told by my coworkers this is the place to get a salad and they are so right.  everything is made fresh daily and the selection is amazing.  prices is reasonable. i will be going here with my coworkers more often now.
